intro: Chlorophytum gallabatense var. micranthum, commonly known as the dwarf spider plant, is a compact, low-maintenance plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It features rosettes of narrow, dark green leaves with white-edged margins, and produces small, white, star-shaped flowers on slender stems. The plant is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its ability to thrive in bright, indirect light and its tolerance for occasional neglect. It is also known for its air-purifying qualities and ability to propagate easily through offsets. This variety is prized for its aesthetic appeal and ease of care in both indoor and outdoor settings.
